result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court calls case and reviews. DA makes statement. Defendant gives bail bond argument. Court orders $10,000 signature bond with conditions of Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.  No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.Comply with and attend all inpatient and after care appointments associated with inpatient treatment program offered through the Wisconsin Department of Corrections. concerning court appearance / routed to JA
Bail/bond hearing on April 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.  No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No possession of knives or guns.

01:10 PM Defendant Timothy M. Schulze in court, in custody, via zoom.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Timothy M. Schulze appeared by video means.   Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. wants to represent himself.  Court goes over waiver of attorney rights. State would request waiver form be sent over to def.  Court will allow def. to represent himself today and will have form sent over to def. Def. is on a probation hold. State gives bail/bond recommendation. Def. heard on bond and request treatment.   Court orders $1,500 cash bond with Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.  No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No possession of knives or guns.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
